newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Philips buys majority Antwerp Bionic Systems.
newsitem.headline: Philips buys majority Antwerp Bionic Systems.

text.p: Philips Electronics NV said on Thursday its unit Philips Hearing Instruments had agreed to buy a majority stake in Antwerp Bionic Systems.
The Belgian firm produces cochlear implant systems or implanted hearing aids.
"For Philips Hearing Instruments, this transaction will provide a valuable expansion of its product range," Philips said in a statement.
Finalisation of the transaction, of which no financial details were disclosed, requires approval of the Belgian authorities and is expected next month.

The agreement includes joint development of a behind-the-ear (BTE) speech processor for current and future cochlear implants. Philips said it will also actively support further market penetration of Antwerp Bionic Systems' products.
